alert.note: Alert for Bradley; East Polk; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 3:52PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Bradley and Polk Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 452 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Cleveland, or 7 miles southwest of Cleveland, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Benton, Ducktown, South Cleveland, East Cleveland, Wildwood Lake, William L. Davenport Refuge, Waterville, Conasauga and Big Frog Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for east Tennessee.
